channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: How to avoid brittle code
item.description: A good short read on some of the things you can do to avoid brittle code. A number of good points, but in particular I liked the discussion about technical debt.

item.title: Maintaining Perl 5: Grant Report for February 2016
item.description: Tony Cook's report on work done against his Perl Foundation grant.

item.title: The Well Sponsored World
item.description: Mark's final post in the series celebrating 10 years of Shadowcat, describing definition of, and approach to, sponsorship.

item.title: A week of Perlishness in Oslo
item.description: Damian is going to be giving a number of talks in Oslo later this month, including some paid classes and public talks.

item.title: ActiveState on the Perl QA Hackathon
item.description: Sheila explains why ActiveState think the QA Hackathon is important, and why they are sponsors this year.

item.title: Strato are sponsoring the QA Hackathon (again!)
item.description: Strato sponsored the QA Hackathon last year, when it was in their home town of Berlin, and they're sponsoring it again this year. They're also looking to hire some German-speaking Perl developers as well.

item.title: Code Archaeology
item.description: Dave shares some code he wrote "back in the day", which he describes as "terrible". It's good to look back at your old code, and hopefully see how you've improved.

item.title: find "stale" processes on linux / unix servers
item.description: Alexey introduces a plugin for his sparrow framework that is used to find potentially stale processes on your server.

item.title: test_requires_git to replace has_git
item.description: An update from BooK about about his Test::Requires::Git module, which he started hacking on after attending last year's QA Hackathon.

item.title: Perl 6 Types: Made for Humans
item.description: Zoffix introduces some of the aspects of Perl 6's typing system.

item.title: Small, but welcome, fixes
item.description: A short update from Jonathan on his recent Perl 6 work.

item.title: On Perl 6 performance
item.description: Zoffix addresses the issue of Perl 6's performance, whether the general perception of it is right. He mentions some recent recent work to start making things faster, and various language features you can use to make your Perl 6 run faster.

item.title: Prove, the harness
item.description: A tutorial on use of the prove utility to run your tests during development.

item.title: The Perl Toolchain: developing your module
item.description: The second in a series of blog posts about the Perl and CPAN infrastructure. This one covers creating, editing, and testing a CPAN distribution. It was supported by ActiveState, who are a gold sponsor for the QA Hackathon this year.

item.title: Private Moose Attributes
item.description: Curtis shows how they've been creating private Moose attributes in a project he's working on, and in the comments other people have shared how they do it.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: March 28th - April 4th
item.description: Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all.

item.title: Introducing Plack::Middleware::Pod
item.description: Max has released Plack::Middleware::Pod — Plack middleware for rendering pod files as HTML.

item.title: Dist::Zilla::PluginBundle::Starter - A new way to start using Dist::Zilla
item.description: Dan introduces his new [@Starter] plugin bundle for Dist::Zilla, aimed at making it easy to get started with DZ while providing more than the traditional [@Basic] bundle.

item.title: Virtual Spring Cleaning (part 4 of X) in which I release Archive::SevenZip
item.description: Max introduces his Archive::SevenZip module, which lets you access files and directories in an archive using an API similar to Path::Class.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: A Date with CPAN: And Now, a Word from Our Sponsor
item.description: Buddy continues his saga on his date and time modules, this time by waxing lyrical about the fabulous CPAN Testers.

item.title: Happy 15th Birthday, Devel::Cover!
item.description: Paul first released Devel::Cover on 9th April 2001, the day after Perl 5.6.1 was released. Paul has been chief maintainer from then 'til now, but he also points out that 86 other people have contributed to it over the last 15 years.

item.title: #246 - 15 years of Devel::Cover
item.description:
It's easy to forget how lucky we are with some of the tools and systems we have available to use as Perl developers. We were reminded of two such pearls this week: Paul Johnson reminded us that we have one of the best test coverage tools of any language. And then Buddy Burden shows why CPAN Testers is so useful.

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
